intro: Apocynum ambigens var. typicum, commonly known as Indian hemp, is a perennial herb native to North America. It is characterized by its woody stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. Its milky sap contains toxic alkaloids, which have been used historically for medicinal and toxicological purposes. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
